entry.name: {{else fieldNameOrExpression}} content {{/if}}

download.p: This documentation topic concerns the jQuery Templates plugin (jquery-tmpl), which can be downloaded from: http://github.com/jquery/jquery-tmpl.

argument.name: fieldNameOrExpression
argument.desc: The name of a field on the current data item, or a JavaScript function or expression to be evaluated.

entry.desc: Used in association with the {{if}}...{{/if}} tag to provide alternative content based on the values of one or more expressions. The {{else}} tag can be used without a parameter, as in: {{if a}}...{{else}}...{{/if}}, or with a parameter, as in: {{if a}}...{{else b}}...{{/if}}.

longdesc.p: Note: For information about how to render templates, see .tmpl() and jQuery.tmpl().

Template tags such as the {{else}} tag can be used within jQuery templates in addition to text and HTML markup, in order to enable a number of scenarios such as composition of templates, iteration over hierarchical data, parameterization of template rendering, etc.
Other available tags include: ${}, {{each}}, {{html}}, {{if}}, {{tmpl}} and {{wrap}}. User-defined template tags can also be specified, by extending the jQuery.tmpl.tag map.
longdesc.h4: Using the {{else}} Template Tag without a parameter
longdesc.p: The following example shows how to use {{if expression}}...{{else}}...{{/if}} to insert conditional content. In the example different content is rendered depending on whether or not the Languages field of the data item is defined.
longdesc.pre: • Title: ${Name}. {{if Languages}} (Alternative languages: ${Languages}). {{else}} (Available only in the original version). {{/if}}
longdesc.h4: Using the {{else}} Template Tag with a parameter
longdesc.p: The following example shows how passing a parameter to {{else expression}} provides the equivalent of additional 'else if' conditional blocks. In the example different content is rendered depending on whether the Languages field of the data item is defined, and if not, depending on whether the Subtitles field of the data item is defined.
longdesc.pre: • Title: ${Name}. {{if Languages}} (Alternative languages: ${Languages}). {{else Subtitles}} (Original language only. Subtitles in ${Subtitles}). {{else}} (Original version only, without subtitles). {{/if}}

example.desc: Using {{if expression}}...{{else}}...{{/if}} to render content conditionally, based on the value of an expression.
example.html: • Title: ${Name}. {{if Languages}} (Alternative languages: ${Languages}). {{else}} (Available only in the original version). {{/if}}

example.desc: Using {{if expression1}}...{{else expression2}}...{{else}}...{{/if}} to render content conditionally, based on the values of different expressions.
example.html: • Title: ${Name}. {{if Languages}} (Alternative languages: ${Languages}). {{else Subtitles}} (Original language only. Subtitles in ${Subtitles}). {{else}} (Original version only, without subtitles). {{/if}}
